column4: I'm trying to install ubuntu on an older laptop - I've gone through 4 cds to try and get a "good" burn - the problem is, they verify correctly on my desktop.  When I check it on the laptop, they all fail the integrity check, although I *just* did on on the desktop.  Bad cd drive?
the md5 is correct - on the iso, and the cd
bad drive or maybe the drive doesn't like the media that you are burning on.
try a different brand of cdr or a slower like 4x burn speed
just installed puppy with the same media batch, earlier today
then try a 4x burn.
everything has been 4x and below
first two were 4x, 3rd was 2x, 4th was 1x
hrm.. thats wierd that they are failing.
they don't fail on the desktop.
there are other methods of installing.
intrepid support is in #ubuntu+1  that may be your whole problem.
intrepid?
this is the alternate install cd for hardy.
lol nvm that was someones name you typed
it's frustrating.  Nothing's workin for me :/
plus, I'm almost out of cds :D
well I highly doubt all those cds are bad.
its most likely an issue witht he drive you are using. As I mentioned before there are other ways to install via usb. etc...
can't boot from usb
old sony vaio, no usb-boot support
what about a network install
dunno - it might work, but it's wiped right now - I'll check it out, and see
going to try making one partition a bootable "cd", and booting from that to install to another :D
